section_title: Payment of expenses of exercise of powers under telephone licence.
section_text: 2 1 Where the council of a borough or  a district  are licensed  to run a public telecommunication system (within the meaning of the Telecommunications Act 1984) , they may . . .   borrow money for the purpose . . .   and the council may, subject to the provisions . . .  of the licence, exercise their powers under the licence throughout the area for which it is granted, although part of that area may be outside the borough or  district. 2 In the application of this Act to Scotland, a royal or parliamentary burgh shall be substituted for a borough, and a police burgh for  a district  . . .  3 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
4 This Act may be cited as the Telegraph Act 1899, . . .
